intro: Rudgea blanchetiana, commonly known as the white-flowered rudgea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Rudgea blanchetiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
